timeline.bodyText: Regarding that the completionHandler will pass the favorite prefs to the collector at each completion request, what's benefit to persist it to the preference store?
timeline.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: See https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ui/blob/master/org.eclipse.jdt.core.manipulation/common/org/eclipse/jdt/core/manipulation/OrganizeImportsOperation.java#L677
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
I see. Here are new comments:

Looks like you also need update the store when the preferences changed.
Since the link you pasted is used to fix the bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=283287, not sure whether the previous workaround in JLS OrganizeImportsHandler is still needed.
https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/master/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/handlers/OrganizeImportsHandler.java#L101-L106
replies.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: those changes belong to the preference manager
replies.author: fbricon
testforstephen

replies.bodyText: Besides, JAVA_COMPLETION_FAVORITE_MEMBERS_DEFAULT in Preferences.java looks a little curious to me. It contains a tailing ":" for each array item. But the default user settings in vscode-java doesn't contain ":". Maybe it works, just curious.
replies.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText:
Since the link you pasted is used to fix the bug https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=283287, not sure whether the previous workaround in JLS OrganizeImportsHandler is still needed.

We have to use the JLs workaround because of redhat-developer/vscode-java#1472
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
When you update the preferenceStore in the plugin start function, the preferences from the client side is not passed to the JLS yet, that means you will always save the default

We don't use JavaManipulationPlugin.CODEASSIST_FAVORITE_STATIC, but have to set it to the blank string.
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
Besides, JAVA_COMPLETION_FAVORITE_MEMBERS_DEFAULT in Preferences.java looks a little curious to me. It contains a tailing ":" for each array item. But the default user settings in vscode-java doesn't contain ":".

Fixed.
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
Regarding that the completionHandler will pass the favorite prefs to the collector at each completion request, what's benefit to persist it to the preference store?

If the JavaManipulationPlugin.CODEASSIST_FAVORITE_STATIC preference is null, some tests throw NPE at OrganizeImportsOperation.java, line 678.
replies.author: snjeza

timeline.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: snjeza

timeline.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: snjeza

timeline.bodyText: Is there any new factor that contributes more completion items?
timeline.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: See https://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/news/4.17/jdt.php#content-assist-substring-types
replies.author: snjeza

timeline.bodyText:
deselect org.eclipse.jdt.ls.tests.syntaxserver too.
Same for other *.launch files.
timeline.author: testforstephen
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -13,7 +13,9 @@
 <booleanAttribute key="clearwslog" value="false"/>
 <stringAttribute key="configLocation" value="${workspace_loc}/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.pde.core/jdt.ls.remote.server"/>
 <booleanAttribute key="default" value="false"/>
-<stringAttribute key="deselected_workspace_plugins" value="org.eclipse.jdt.ls.tests,org.eclipse.jdt.ls.tests.syntaxserver,org.eclipse.jdt.ui"/>
+<setAttribute key="deselected_workspace_bundles">
+<setEntry value="org.eclipse.jdt.ls.tests"/>

replies.bodyText: and what about org.eclipse.jdt.ui?
replies.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText: Fixed. org.eclipse.jdt.ui is not in the workspace.
replies.author: snjeza

timeline.bodyText: which plugin introduces the dependencies for org.apache.felix.scr and org.eclipse.equinox.ds?
timeline.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText:
`There aren't any dependencies, but Java LS will not start without them. See also https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=538737
org.eclipse.equinox.ds is deprecated. I have replaced it with org.eclipse.e4.core.services and dependencies.
See https://help.eclipse.org/2020-06/index.jsp?topic=%2Forg.eclipse.platform.doc.isv%2Fporting%2F4.10%2Frecommended.html&cp%3D2_3_1_3&anchor=EquinoxDS_to_FelixSCR
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
so if org.eclipse.equinox.ds is deprecated, would you still want to keep it in languageServer.product?
Also we need verify whether to update syntaxServer.product file either. In theory, if the new dependencies are introduced by the fundamental platform, they need to be updated for syntaxServer.
replies.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: Fixed.
replies.author: snjeza

timeline.bodyText:
With the new PR, i also observed the completion performance on type degraded.
Environment:

Hardware

MacBook Pro (13-inch, 2016, Four Thunderbolt 3 Ports)
Procesor: 2.9 GHz Dual-Core Intel Core i5
Memory: 8 GB 2133 MHz LPDDR3


Project: https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-petclinic
VS Code 1.48, only with Language Support for Java enabled.

Old:

New:
It takes more than 3s to get the completion of String. If you only type S, it's slower.

This issue should be related with the new Substring/Subword matches for types https://www.eclipse.org/eclipse/news/4.17/jdt.php#content-assist-substring-types.
It seems it only provides switch to control subwords match, we need evaluate more on the new change.
timeline.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: @testforstephen can you try disabling subwords match in the JDT preferences, see if it restores the performance?
replies.author: fbricon
testforstephen

replies.bodyText: i suggest we keep the max completion timeout to 5s in the test case. This will guard the possible performance issue.
replies.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText:
options.put(AssistOptions.OPTION_SubwordMatch, AssistOptions.DISABLED) 

should be added in the preferencemanager
replies.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText:
i suggest we keep the max completion timeout to 5s in the test case. This will guard the possible performance issue.

Some tests fail randomly without this option. See #1411 (review)
The option is used only in tests
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
options.put(AssistOptions.OPTION_SubwordMatch, AssistOptions.DISABLED)
should be added in the preferencemanager

Done
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText: Please turn off substring match too. It's the main factor to slow down the completion performance. Find the switch in my comment above.
replies.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: It is done. See 59f3ea0#diff-ce44e5aecff47a5dd96a42b0a961f48cR86
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText: No, that line only turns off subword match. The switch for substring match is System.setProperty(AssistOptions.PROPERTY_SubstringMatch, "false")
replies.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: Done. See f520966#diff-55f26b9037b6c92ad4701f61028ae2cdR190
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
Just a heads-up regarding this feature. It might be worth revisiting once we adopt 2021-03 M1.
https://www.eclipse.org/lists/platform-dev/msg02635.html
replies.author: rgrunber

replies.bodyText: The parallel index search looks promising.
replies.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: I tried to test this and while I think there might be a bit of an improvement using JDT Core 2021-03 M1, it still was much slower than with subword feature completely disabled so will have to look on the upstream bug.
replies.author: rgrunber
